title: Tyson Fury not ruling out WWE clash with Anthony Joshua
text:
Fury makes his bow in WWE this week (Picture: Getty)

While the boxing world is desperate to see Tyson Fury take on Anthony Joshua, the Gypsy King suggested their showdown could happen in a WWE ring.

Fury is poised to make his debut in WWE this Thursday, where he will take on his new arch nemesis Braun Strowman.

The heavyweight shocked the world with his cross over to WWE this month, and thinks Joshua and UFC star Conor McGregor should consider a stint in the wrestling world.

‘Who knows what the future holds,’ Fury said about fighting Joshua in WWE.

‘[Conor McGregor should] come along and have a go. Ronda Rousey is in there and Cain Valesquez has just signed up.

‘Brock Lesnar was the heavyweight champion in the UFC. Everyone should have a crack, have a go.

‘Don’t let anyone put you off and tell you not to do something just because they can’t do it.’

The match with Strowman has generated big interest in the UK and USA and Fury is reportedly set to collect over £10million for the appearance.

The WWE have always carefully choreographed their guest stars matches and more and more combat sport stars are making the move into wrestling.

Former UFC champions Ronda Rousey, Brock Lesnar and Cain Valesquez have all crossed over, with the two heavyweights booked to fight each other on the same night as Fury vs Strowman.

Strowman welcomes Fury to the WWE (Picture: Getty)

While Fury is expected to make millions from his rematch with WBC champion Wilder, the 31-year-old believes the WWE is the best entertainment in the sports world.

‘I think WWE is the best value in sports entertainment, barring none. The best entertainment,’ Fury insisted.

‘Going there ringside and watching these gigantic athletes dive off the top ropes and do back flips.

‘It’s an amazing thing to watch and very, very entertaining.’

description: Tyson Fury has urged boxing rival Anthony Joshua to follow him in WWE, as the heavyweight boxer prepares to make his debut.
